• Moving your Application to Amazon Cloud – Not rails specific, but does bring some order to that abbreviations chaos.
  • 10 awful IE bugs and fixes – tame the beast.
  • Unofficial Ruby usage guide – originally written for Google.
  • Font Stacks – a walkthrough – an overview of simple and clean font stacks for your next designs.
  • Setup a DNS server on Ubuntu – don’t know why i would need that, but just in case.
  • Rails API authentication using restful-authentication – yeah, i hate that plugin too, but it’s a good wireframe to what ever needs to be done on Authlogic.
  • Pushing to multiple Git repos – ever wanted to do something? mike has the answers.
  • Python vs. Ruby – the flame is on?
  • jQuery Tools – jQuery UI’s lost brother.
  • Keep IP addresses as Integers – mrkris is mad again, and this time – he is right.
  • Testing observers with Shoulda – a macro set by Tobias.
  • Processing.js – javascript animation unleashed.
  • PrettyPrint for javascript – print javascript objects in a nice way.
  • jsPDF – generate PDF files, with JS.
  • jqTransform – pretty forms with jquery, customizable too.
  • IP address Geo-Location, JSON – a JS binding for the IPLocationTools.com API.
  • SocialHistory.js – check on which social network your user is on.
  • Gmail/Facebook style chat in jQuery – handy handy handy.
  • jQuery full-calendar – a fully functional calendar, including drag&drop, resize and more.
  • fireCrystal – Firefox extension for programmers and designers – FireCrystal is a Firefox extension that helps designers and programmers alike figure out how interactive behaviors on the web work.
  • jQuery inline form validations – a nice validation plugin for jQuery, nice appearance too.
  • Unit testing jQuery with fireUnit and qUnit – as the title says.
  • 20 mac apps to increase your productivity – i should go and read that.
  • MockApp – iPhone mockup’ing

GitHub Treasures

  • request-log-analyzer – A command line tool that analyzes request logfiles (e.g. Rails, Merb, Apache) to produce a performance report.
  • capistrano-db-tasks – rake like tasks for capsitrano.
  • noisy-partials – makes your partial to render HTML comments with their name.
  • gltail – real time log parser for rails / server log.
  • ambitious-query-indexes – a plugin that scans your test database (i know, should be production.. i guess there’s a good reason for that), sounds like a good addition to my RailsIndexes.
